content.rendered:
At AqualisBraemar, energy and the oceans are at the centre of our business. The sustainability of both is vital for the future of our company and the world in which we operate.

Many of our staff, whether offshore wind professionals, master mariners, chief engineers or offshore engineers and surveyors, are passionate about the world’s oceans, and of course their wellbeing and the survival of their rich diversity. 

“In Q1 this year, we made concrete commitments to ensure sustainability is at the heart of our business and its strategy and operations. We became a signatory of the United Nations Global Compact, and we launched our sustainability programme AqualisBraemar2030.” Said David Wells, AqualisBraemar CEO.

“The health of the oceans is hugely important to the planet and all forms of life. It is particularly important to our company, as specialist consultants to the offshore renewable and marine sectors, and incumbent on us to play our part in protecting this environment. As a small statement the whole management team of the Group has signed this petition, we call on the world’s leaders to protect 30% of our blue planet by 2030”.

World Oceans Day is a collaboration in conservation with a global network of leaders in 140 countries, providing resources for all to take action to restore and protect the ocean, and empowered by the World Oceans Day Youth Advisory Council.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports UN Global Compact
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: By signalling this intent, AqualisBraemar commits to making the UN Global Compact, and its principles, part of the strategy, culture and day-to-day operations of the company, and to engage in collaborative projects which advance the broader development goals of the United Nations, particularly its sustainable development goals.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Human Rights Day
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar, through its signatory status with United Nations Global Compact, recognises that human rights are at the centre of the Social Development Goals (SDG).

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to ramp up international adjusting business
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to launch an international recruitment drive to ramp up its adjustment business serving all aspects of the oil, gas, power and marine sectors.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar beefs up ports & harbours offering to tackle renewables rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to ramp up its ports and harbours unit and combine resources and know-how with its offshore wind consultancy unit OWC, following a surge in assignments driven by renewable energy developments.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar targets Russian market
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has opened its first office in Russia, based in Moscow, to further enhance the group’s service offering in the Russian energy, marine and loss adjusting markets.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar shortlisted for Energy Transition award
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has been shortlisted for EIC's Energy Transition Award in their annual EIC Awards. The award recognises companies that contribute or demonstrate the next wave of technologies, beyond wind and solar, that will deliver the 2050 net-zero carbon goals of the UK.
